Table of Contents

Interface IRuleService

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Services
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll

Service interface for automated rules engine management. Provides comprehensive rule lifecycle management, article evaluation, and action execution capabilities.

public interface IRuleService

Remarks

This service centralizes all rule-related functionality including:

  • Rule CRUD operations with validation and duplicate prevention
  • Article evaluation against all active rules
  • Rule action execution (notifications, tagging, marking read, etc.)
  • Statistics tracking for rule effectiveness monitoring
  • Performance-optimized batch processing for multiple articles

All methods return DTOs instead of entities to maintain separation of concerns.

Methods

AddRuleConditionAsync(CreateRuleConditionDto, CancellationToken)

Adds a condition to an existing rule.

Task<RuleConditionDto> AddRuleConditionAsync(CreateRuleConditionDto createDto, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

createDto CreateRuleConditionDto

The DTO containing condition creation data.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<RuleConditionDto>

The created condition DTO.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if createDto is null.

ArgumentException

Thrown if condition validation fails.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if the parent rule doesn't exist.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

CreateRuleAsync(CreateRuleDto, CancellationToken)

Creates a new rule in the system.

Task<RuleDto> CreateRuleAsync(CreateRuleDto createDto, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

createDto CreateRuleDto

The DTO containing rule creation data.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<RuleDto>

The created rule DTO with generated ID and timestamps.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if createDto is null.

ArgumentException

Thrown if rule validation fails (invalid name, conditions, etc.).

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if a rule with the same name already exists.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

DeleteRuleAsync(int, CancellationToken)

Deletes a rule by its unique identifier.

Task<bool> DeleteRuleAsync(int ruleId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

ruleId int

The ID of the rule to delete.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<bool>

True if deletion was successful; otherwise, false (e.g., rule not found).

Exceptions

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Thrown if ruleId is less than or equal to 0.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

GetActiveRulesAsync(CancellationToken)

Retrieves only active rules that should be evaluated against new articles.

Task<List<RuleDto>> GetActiveRulesAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<List<RuleDto>>

A list of active rule DTOs.

Remarks

Only rules with IsEnabled = true are returned. This method is optimized for frequent calls during article processing.

Exceptions

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

Retrieves the most frequently matched rules.

Parameters

Maximum number of rules to return. Default: 10.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<List<RuleHealthDto>>

A list of rule health DTOs ordered by match count descending.

Exceptions

Thrown if limit is less than 1.

TestRuleAsync(int, List<int>, CancellationToken)

Tests a rule against sample articles without saving or executing actions.

Task<RuleTestResultDto> TestRuleAsync(int ruleId, List<int> sampleArticleIds, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

ruleId int

The ID of the rule to test (can be unsaved, pass 0 for new rule).

sampleArticleIds List<int>

List of article IDs to test against.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<RuleTestResultDto>

A test result containing match statistics.

Remarks

This method provides a safe way to preview which articles would match a rule without affecting real data or executing actions.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if sampleArticleIds is null.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

UpdateRuleAsync(int, UpdateRuleDto, CancellationToken)

Updates an existing rule.

Parameters

ruleId int

The ID of the rule to update.

updateDto UpdateRuleDto

The DTO containing rule update data.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<RuleDto>

The updated rule DTO if successful; otherwise, null.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if updateDto is null.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Thrown if ruleId is less than or equal to 0.

ArgumentException

Thrown if rule validation fails.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if another rule with the same name already exists.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.
